page.title: 17EVENTS AND CUSTOMS.
page.content: In 1865 a wake was held to celebrate the opening of St.Annes Church.In 1919 the wakes moved to Mrs.McOchom's field (now Burntwood Recreation Centre).The wakes is now a prominent part of the leisure activities of Burntwood and is held on the first Saturday in August. The activities include a street parade, Fun Fair and side shows. About 10,000 people attend each year. In 1984 a stage of the Milk cycle race finished in Burntwood. Local speech has varied considerably through the years.The following list provides some examples:Swag-pond,cut- canal,cinderhole-pond,tipmounts-dump, spineywood and wreck-wasteland. Nearby Chasewater provides water- sport activities.Many international events have been held there such as the Grand Prix and the annual Chasewater Show.
